{"title":"page 47","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"much of the slow progress of the Mechanic Arts.
Those arts, however, as we must suppose, had
arrived at a certain degree of improvement at
the time when we hear of the construction of the
tower of Babel, the confused multiplicity of
language, the dissemination of the human race—
and the deluge. From Noah to the siege of
Troy, it is difficult to ascertain the number of
centuries which elapsed; but, at that epoch of
the existence "of mankind, the .Mechanic Arts
.Kings and princes prepared their own victuals,
and were nothing but crowned butchers and
sceptred cooks, and their wives, daughters and","fullrs":{},"find":"1971.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"1970","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"439239","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.42 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
